name: Ignatius of Antioch
subtitle: Apostolic Witness to the Bodily Resurrection
details: Ignatius, facing his own martyrdom, affirmed Jesus' bodily resurrection based on the apostles' direct encounter with the risen Lord. He stated that Jesus appeared in the flesh after the resurrection and invited disciples to touch him, which led them to believe and 'despise death.'
whyItMatters: This passage emphasizes a bodily resurrection (countering docetism).
It highlights the direct experiential basis for apostolic belief and courage.
It showcases a martyr's authority by linking belief in the resurrection to a willingness to die for the truth.
